alert.note: Alert for Le Flore; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 20 at 8:01AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN CRAWFORD... NORTHWESTERN SEBASTIAN...SOUTHEASTERN SEQUOYAH AND NORTHEASTERN LE FLORE COUNTIES THROUGH 830 AM CST... At 800 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Roland, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Cedarville... Alma... Barling... Muldrow... Roland... Arkoma... Mulberry... Dyer... Moffett... Rudy... Figure Five... Fort Smith Regional Airport... Kibler... Concord... Shibley... Braden... Mill Creek... Cottonwood... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 19. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 316 and 328. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 14. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
